intro: Linaria unaiensis, commonly known as the Maltese toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the island of Malta. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive spurred shape, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species of Malta.
